issue.title: www.twitch.tv

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/154901#issue-1778604324, https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/154901#issuecomment-1615951364 - It looks like part of the website functionality, I don't think that it should be blocked.

<hr>

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/154901#issuecomment-1616409044 - It's caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`, so please disable that filter list or add this rule:
```adblock
bing.com#@$##b_tq_header, .header, .sbox { position: absolute !important; }
```
to user rules.

comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
>what about malicious ad redirect?

It should be also already blocked, but please note that due to Apple restrictions/limitations on iOS (the same problem is with extensions for Safari) some rules sometimes can be executed too late and due to this some popups/popunders cannot be blocked.

>And what about Best website to watch?

I have added a rule which should fixes it, filters update should be available in 1-2 hours.

If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
The website has low visitors. But you can block it manually or try these rules.
```adblock
yimenapp.net##.tag-banner
yimenapp.net##.tag-banner ~ p[style^="text-align:center;margin-bottom:20px;"]
```

### Issue URL (Ads) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment Username: @hhuseyinsil > I've been using adguard home on my cloud server for a long time. It blocks all ads on the internet without adding any extra filters. I installed it on my windowsI've been using adguard home on my cloud server for a long time. It blocks all ads on the internet without adding any extra filters. I installed it on my windows computer today. I filtered using the addresses 127.0.0.1 and 192.168.1.24. Ads are blocked on many sites. but youtube and twitch ads are not blocked as in the cloud server. What is the difference between cloud server and windows computer? Isn't it possible for me to block all ads like in the cloud? computer today. I filtered using the addresses 127.0.0.1 and 192.168.1.24. Oww ok sir
